intro: Cyathocalyx insularis, commonly known as the Island Cyathocalyx, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of red, pink, or yellow. Its leaves are ovate and have a smooth texture, while its stems are woody and often branched. This species is often found in coastal areas and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils.
